data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Was a nice little place with a country farm theme.  Good food and service.  Worth a visit if your in Tracy.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: On our way back home we needed to stop for breakfast and my daughter found this place which was a bit out of our way but well worth it.  Great food and Service!

data.title: Burger Time
data.text: We decided to run into Tracy to our favorite burger place Town & Country Cafe .One day we will have to try breakfast . Was not disappointed. We ordered the Rosie Burger and the Bleu Burger. Both were delicious!!

data.title: Breakfast and Lunch amazing
data.text: We are never disappointed. Every time we visit the staff is warm and friendly.The food is nicely presented and delicious.  Always our restaurant of choice for breakfast or lunch.

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text: This is a go to place if your having breakfast in Tracy - Local all know of this place. Food is wonderful and service is very good, must try there Rolls

data.title: They took FOREVER.
data.text: My mom and I decided to try this place for lunch. We ordered the soup and drinks and it took over 60 minutes to even get our food.

data.title: A variety of Eggs Benedict and omlettes that will make your mouth water!
data.text: The chef obviously is passionate about her food. Breakfasts are incredible.  I've not had lunch..yet!

data.title: Rate it right
data.text:
It was Saturday morning and 6 of us decided to meet at 8am to eat then enjoy the farmers market.
They opened at 8am knowing the FM is in full swing and the nice waitress sat us down.  We weren't in a rush but it took an hour to get our food.  Then when the split bill was presented to us to my surprise our waitress added a 20% tip to the late meal?
I enjoy good food but there's was ok but the coffee was excellent. kitchen service was terrible at best.  I felt we should of got the meal free but there was not even an apologie for the horrible kitchen staff.
My opinion is the owner should anticipate the FM and be ready to serve and move people along just from a business model let alone satisfying customers.  Then to allow an added 20% tip for 6 people is pretty much setting up the restraunt for failure.

data.title: A good bet or bite for lunch.
data.text: A smallish, but delightful restaurant in downtown Tracy.  The sandwiches were all tasty (we sampled each other's food) and the service was good.  We were in a hurry and didn't get to sample the home made desserts which looked fantastic; we will go back for a dessert, for sure.

data.title: Good eats, small portions
data.text: Nice place downtown.  Service is slow.  Wait staff not too friendly.  Breakfast was good but small portions.

data.title: Excellent Food, Friendly people, great atmosphere
data.text:
I am a picky person who can very rarely (if ever) call my meal PERFECT.  I was able to do that today.  My GIANT breakfast (at least twice what I actually should have eaten) was PERFECTLY done.  I didn't use the ketchup I asked for, and never touched the salt or pepper.

AND . . . the food is hardly the best thing about it.  It feels FANTASTIC to be a customer there.  The staff is hustling hustling hustling to serve everybody, but have always been very friendly and accessible.  I don't really enjoy a bored or aloof serving staff, and the crew at T&C are real people who are really friendly.

Today the restaurant was PACK with people, but the customers were never treated as a bother or just another party to be herded like cattle.

I enjoy the place.  If I ever get to achieve my retirement, I am eating there at least once a week.  I hope for the best of success for these fine folks.

data.title: Good Breakfast
data.text: We go out every Sunday for brunch and have not tried Town and Country until recently. My spouse had been there for lunch and enjoyed it so off we went. It has very limited seating although if the weather is good you can eat outside. The weather was not good and they were juggling chairs and tables and people were waiting. The breakfast as very good. The variety and choices were many. The downside may be the odd arrangement of tables and some of the chairs could be better. It is has been popular in the downtown. The service was slower than expected but the servers were attentive. All this being said, it is a pleasant place to have a leisurely meal if you have the time. Grading on the curve is a solid better than average.

data.title: Best thing since NYC
data.text: Finally a place to have a meal that compares to NYC. The food is amazing and the menu is about as cosmopolitan as it comes considering where we are. Bravo!!!!!

data.title: Half way to a good dining experience
data.text:
Decided to dine here after we saw that they were voted #1 in Tracy five of the last 6 years. Lets break down the place and measure it.

Ambiance: B   Add some seat cushions to make those wire back chairs more comfy. After all you want to have the customer leave and think "im full, that was great". I left and thought "wow, my booty hurts from that chair".

Front of the house service: B+. The server was polite, helpful and appolgetic if the foo was not up the our expectation.

Food Quality: C-  Our two orders left us both hoping for a better description that was in line with the product. I had the "Hungry Hunter" breakfast. That's an 8 oz rib eye and Eggs, Potatoes cooked to order. A small bit of feed back owners, if your going to have a signature dish then it should contain something uniquely different. The biscuits were also missing from the served plate.

Serving time (post order): D There is just no love into the food and they struggle with the basic understanding of what order to cook the food in so it all lands on the table hot.

Overall: C+  There is work to be done to make this a stand out even in this valley town.

data.title: Almost a 5
data.text: This cute little cafe is located on the same street as the Farmer's Market so I walk past it practically every Saturday. Finally had a chance to check out their food this past weekend when my son and his girlfriend was visiting. We arrived for breakfast around 9:30 AM and it was packed. We waited for around 10 minutes. We were seated at a table that I noticed was vacant when we signed the waiting list. What?? They took out drink requests and gave us our menus and we waited, and waited, and waited. When our waitress finally came to take our order, she joked that she was waiting to see how long she could wait until we started complaining. What?? They have quite a few Benedict dishes on the menu and we each ordered a different one. Mine was had turkey and avocado on focaccia. It was delicious. My son's was bacon with gravy on biscuits. So in a nutshell, we really enjoyed the food but the service is something to be desired.

data.title: Catering and Breakfast is done well
data.text: Town and Country Cafe has great breakfasts, its great to eat there on Saturday mornings prior to going to the farmers market.  We have had them cater a party and they did a wonderful job.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: Third time not the charm....Was so disappointed this morning.  Got name on waiting list (15 minutes)...20 minutes later another couple who arrived after us got a table....Served orange juice in a styrofoam cup...yes they were busy but had no clean glassware?  Asked for simple eggs (soft scramble) and sausage.  Sausage cold, eggs burnt, potatoes tasteless (add some peppers and onions).  I have never sent anything back but did today and breakfast came back...cold potatoes, eggs burnt and sausage cold.  Service was terrible.  toast not even toasted.  Had to get up and get own utensils as did several customers.  Disappointed because it would be nice to have a quaint little restaurant to frequent and become a regular....will have to keep looking.

data.title: Cute and Quaint and awesome food
data.text: I loved this place from the moment I walked in!  It is so cute on the inside.  Wait staff was very friendly and you feel like you are at your extended families table for a meal.  I had the pesto ravioli... to die for!!!  Comes with salad too... great value and delicious

data.title: Table service and serving dinner now!
data.text: Our family ate at Town & Country restaurant for the first time tonight.  We loved the bread, oil and garlic plate that they greet you with. Portions are generous, food is fresh and delicious. The staff is very friendly and efficient. I will have to come back for breakfast. I heard that their morning menu is legendary, especially the cinnamon rolls. The room was a little loud. I saw sound -absorbing wall hangings, but they could use some more.  The customers seemed to be enjoying themselves though, so that's good.
